item.title: Write You A Haskell
item.description: This is just a casual writeup of WYAH as I read through it. Prereading Glossary monad transformer You have an innermost monad (usually Identity or IO but you can use any monad). You then wrap monad transformers around this monad to make bigger, better monads. https://page.mi.fu-berlin.de/scravy/realworldhaskell/materialien/monad-transformers-step-by-step.pdf It is possible to create custom monads simply by composing the necessary monad transformers. For example, if you need a monad with state and error handling, just take the StateT and ErrorT monad transformers and combine them.
